item.title: Report E-2024010289
item.description:
Report E-2024010289

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 11, 2024, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN2922 were damaged due to a fire in the unit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the tops of the drums and the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Advanced Environmental Solutions (AES) to remediate the impacted site. AES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted surfaces of the trailer interior and worked them in with hand tools. AES personnel then utilized absorbent wipes to wipe any residual amount of released material from the top of the drums. All UN2922 impacted material was collected and containerized in eight (8) 95-gallon overpacks with other waste that were staged on-site in RLC's designated waste area.

item.title: Report X-2024010455
item.description:
Report X-2024010455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-29
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the van in leaking condition. Swept up loose material with a broom and dustpan. Placed damaged package in a spill bin to take back to the QA cage for further inspection. Upon further inspection, found bottom of inner cylinder/pail to have cracked. DescribePack: Crack at the base of the cylinder/pail that runs across the entire diameter. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All protruding material was immediately swept up and taken to a QA cage for inspection in addition to bringing the cylinder/pail back to the QA cage.
